subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsville WV
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_00AF_01C9DEE9.43764360
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

You have to understand that as Steve said, we all have our own beliefs. Not=
 all of us are Christian.

I believe it is not my problem or place to inter=
fere with the salvation of anyone's soul. That is between them and their Go=
d.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: SnowfireL@... 
  To: EVP-IT=
C@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 4:12 PM
  Subject: Re: [=
EVP-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsville WV






  What happened to "pray fo=
r them that use you, do good for those that despitefully use you" "pray for=
 the enemy, "love your enemy's as you love yourselves" forgive them"?  Oh d=
on't worry they must make up for what they have done in the past, no one ge=
ts away with anything in life, we all must face Our Maker one day, but in n=
ot moving them on is only slowing things down.  Don't worry, we all pay for=
 all, and any harm we have caused while here.  We all have to pay the piper=
, in leaving them there does not help anyone except those selling tickets  =
And who knows once they have crossed over they may go back to make amends f=
or those murders, rapes and crimes  .sf

  In a message dated 5/27/2009 5:5=
4:16 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time, april@... writes:=





    Oh don't EVEN get me started on the homeless thing...

    Those "=
poor ghosts" in that prison were murderers, rapist, etc. They put themselve=
s there. They have the capacity to free themselves if they would realize it=
. In fact they would probably learn something by doing it themselves, as op=
posed to getting it handed to them without working for it.

    I wish them=
 neither harm nor foul, but I will not go out of my way to help any such so=
ul.



      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: SnowfireL@... 
 =
     To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 2:05 =
PM
      Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsville WV



      I=
sn't this kind of like a poor person on the street, living in a cardboard b=
ox, or in poverty, sure they put themselves there, many disowned by family,=
 lost of jobs, no education, lack of motivation when they were children, a =
drunken family that was nothing but selfish, didn't care about their own ch=
ildren, nor the future of the children.  These are ignored by strangers, an=
d the community, look away, no one sees them so, they are don't exist.  Bum=
s the lot of them!  Is this how it's to be forever?  Poor ghosts of society=
, they should be helped in any way we can, prayer is like sending positive =
wishes, thoughts are things, negatives bring more negatives, positive thoug=
hts do help others.   And so nothing changes, nothing improves...

      In=
 a message dated 5/27/2009 3:49:16 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time, april@abercr=
ombieghostresearch.com writes:




        I say they put themselves in the=
re, they can get themselves out.

          ----- Original Message ----- 
 =
         From: Steve Hill 
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
         =
 Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 1:40 PM
          Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Gho=
st Box Demo at Moundsville WV



          Yes, you need speical permission=
. I was there for an all night ghost hunt as a guest of Eastern Paranormal.=
 The place can be rented at night but believe me when I say "it ain't cheap=
". Plus I don't think the prison would appreciate me releaseing the inmates=
 before their eternal sentence has been served.
          Steve




-------=
---------------------------------------------------------------
          F=
rom: "SnowfireL@..." <SnowfireL@...>
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogro=
ups.com
          Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 2:31:57 PM
          Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsville WV



          Does one nee=
d special permission to get in there?  You folks should go back, and releas=
e them since a few of them already know you Steve, this is Steve?  Right?  =
sf

          In a message dated 5/27/2009 2:15:10 P.M. Eastern Daylight Ti=
me, foreverhaunted57@ yahoo.com writes:




            Unfortunately I did=
 not get to attempt to cross them. After my demonstration, another group th=
at was also there started complaining that the box made too much noise and =
was hendering their investigation so I turned it off. I wouldn't want my di=
rect communication with the deceased inmates to mess up their EVP work, now=
 would I? I apoligized and put it away for the rest of the night.
         =
    According to the prison staff, the inmates firmly believed that if they=
 died in prison their souls would be forever trapped there. This belief was=
 so strong that the prison officials would take the elderly inmates who wer=
e dying of natural causes to a local hospital so they would'nt have to die =
in the prison. Maybe their beliefs were well founded.     




------------=
--------------------------------------------------------
            From: =
"SnowfireL@aol. com" <SnowfireL@aol. com>
            To: EVP-ITC@yahoogrou=
ps .com
            Sent: Wednesday, May 27, 2009 12:36:12 PM
            S=
ubject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ghost Box Demo at Moundsville WV



            This =
is a wonderful recording, were you able to free any of them?  So sad to see=
 them still there behind bars, must be very lonely for them, they should be=
 moving on so, they can start to work on making up for things on the other =
side.  You folks should go up there again, and hold a small prayer vigil fo=
r them, of course they would no longer be ghosts trapped there, but there a=
re plenty more around. sf

            In a message dated 5/27/2009 12:10:5=
6 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time, foreverhaunted57@ yahoo.com writes:



      =
        I was invited to spend the night in the West Virginia Penitentiary =
this past weekend.. I was asked to give a short demonstration with my Optim=
us 12-797 hacked radio. Deep inside the prison surrounded by concrete and s=
teel, the radio could not pick up any radio stations in manual mode. I wasn=
't sure how this might effect the demonstration. I was pleasantly suprised =
with the results. I recorded the session and the results can be heard at th=
is link. http://www.youtube. com/watch? v=3DKwDYu4RULlk
